intro: Gomphandra capitulata, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is found in mountainous regions. It produces tiny, four-petaled flowers that are often white or pink in color. Gomphandra capitulata is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
